abstract: A flurry of articles raising questions about Google‘s $1.65 billion acquisition of YouTube — a flurry that included an item on DealBook — totally misses the point. That is the view of Henry Blodget, the author and former Internet analyst, who wrote about this recent negativity on his Internet Outsider blog. Last week’s revelation that YouTube booked just $15 million in revenue last year, meaning that Google paid more than 100 times revenue for the video-sharing Web site, is basically “irrelevant,” Mr. Blodget wrote.
lead_paragraph: A flurry of articles raising questions about Google‘s $1.65 billion acquisition of YouTube — a flurry that included an item on DealBook — totally misses the point. That is the view of Henry Blodget, the author and former Internet analyst, who wrote about this recent negativity on his Internet Outsider blog. Last week’s revelation that YouTube booked just $15 million in revenue last year, meaning that Google paid more than 100 times revenue for the video-sharing Web site, is basically “irrelevant,” Mr. Blodget wrote.
